TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy, mixed Typic Cryaquepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Bulky sandy loam, forested, on an outwash delta, on a slope of 1 percent at an elevation of 7 m (When described on June 21, 2014, the soil was wet throughout.)
Oe--0 to 5 cm; moderately decomposed plant material; extremely acid (pH 4.2); clear wavy boundary
Bg1--5 to 25 cm; sandy loam, dark gray (5Y 4/1) dry, dark bluish gray (5B 4/1) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine, fine, and, medium roots throughout; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; 20 percent masses of oxidized iron, strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) moist; strongly acid (pH 5.4); abrupt wavy boundary
Bg2--25 to 50 cm; silt loam, dark gray (5Y 4/1) dry, dark greenish gray (5G 4/1) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common fine roots; common very fine interstitial pores; moderately acid (pH 6.0); clear smooth boundary
Cg--50 to 150 cm; sand, dark gray (5Y 4/1) dry, dark gray (N 4/0) moist; massive; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; very slightly effervescent (HCL, 1N); neutral (pH 6.9)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve-Gustavus Area, Alaska; Hoonah-Angoon Census Area; latitude 58.3762680, longitude -136.3793060, datum WGS84 (coordinates determined by a GPS unit)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--1 to 7 degrees C
Soil moisture control section--usually saturated at or near soil surface year round
Depth to redoximorphic iron concentrations--less than 25 cm
Clay content in particle-size control section--5 to 10 percent
Oe horizon
Thickness--0 to 8 cm
Bg1 horizon
Hue--2.5Y, 5Y, or 5B moist or dry
Value--3 or 4 moist or dry
Chroma--1 or 2 moist or dry
Fine-earth texture--silt loam, sandy loam
Clay content--3 to 8 percent
Reaction (pH)--5.4 to 6.0
Thickness--15 to 30 cm
Bg2 horizon
Hue--2.5Y, 5Y, or 5G moist or dry
Value--3 or 4 moist or dry
Chroma--1 or 2 moist or dry
Fine-earth texture--silt loam, sandy loam
Clay content--5 to 17 percent
Reaction (pH)--5.4 to 7.5
Thickness--20 to 35 cm
Cg horizon
Hue--2.5Y, 5Y, or neutral moist or dry
Value--2 to 4 moist or dry
Chroma--0 to 3 moist or dry
Clay content--0 to 2 percent
Sand content--90 to 100 percent
Reaction (pH)--6.9 to 7.3
Thickness--50 to 120 cm

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
Oberlin--aquic conditions and free carbonates within 25 cm of soil surface; lithologic discontinuity

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--0 to 200 m
Climate--cool, moist summers; mild, wet winters
Mean annual precipitation--1750 to 3350 mm
Mean annual air temperature--3 to 8 degrees C
Frost-free period--90 to 154 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Annoksek--25 to 50 cm (shallow) to a lithic contact; on adjacent landforms
Bertha--no aquic conditions (well drained); on similar landforms
Icy--free carbonates throughout particle-size control section; aquic conditions at or near soil surface; on adjacent landforms
Kashoto--organic (muck); in muskegs of adjacent landforms
Murkbay--no aquic conditions (well drained); on adjacent landforms
Puffin--free carbonates throughout; on similar landforms

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--very poorly drained
Ponding--frequent, long periods
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--moderately low in Bg horizon, high in Cg horizon

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation, subsistence
Potential natural vegetation--bog blueberry, undergreen willow, Sitka spruce, arctic starflower, sphagnum, meadow horsetail

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Alexander Archipelago-Gulf of Alaska Coast, Alaska; MLRA 220; moderate extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve-Gustavus Area, Alaska; 2020; name from Mount Bulky in Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Ochric epipedon
*Aquic conditions--zone from 5 to 150 cm
*Cambic horizon--zone from 5 to 50 cm
*Redoximorphic concentrations--zone from 5 to 25 cm
*Reduced matrix--zone from 5 to 150 cm
*Free carbonates--zone from 50 to 150 cm
*Particle-size control section--zone from 30 to 105 cm
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
